text: Dysoxylum gotadhora is a tree in the family Meliaceae. It is native to Bhutan, India, Laos, Nepal, Thailand, Vietnam. The name Dysoxylum ficiforme (Wight) Gamble in India and Sri Lanka is categorized as the same plant.http://keralaplants.in/keralaplantsdetails.aspx?id=Dysoxylum_ficiforme ==Description== The tree grows up to tall.http://www.efloras.org/florataxon.aspx?flora_id=2&taxon;_id=250084152 Hartwood is reddish color.http://tropical.theferns.info/viewtropical.php?id=Dysoxylum+gotadhora Leaves are Leaves compound, imparipinnate; apex acuminate; base asymmetric- attenuate with entire margin.http://indiabiodiversity.org/species/show/11156 Flowers are white colored and show axillary panicles inflorescence. Fruit is a four-seeded obovoid capsule, becomes red when ripened. Seeds are dark purple with white aril.http://www.biotik.org/india/species/d/dysofici/dysofici_en.html ==References== * gotadhora Category:Trees of the Indian subcontinent Category:Trees of Indo-China Category:Plants described in 1875
title: Dysoxylum gotadhora
